instructions:
Drizzle lemon juice over fillets, then roll fish in olive oil and place on a greased baking sheet with rim.
Drizzle a little more oil on top and bake in a 375 degree oven till fish flakes, about 8 to 10 minutes. Do not
overcook. Remove from oven and drain juices. In the meantime, melt butter in a large frying pan and cook
mushrooms and scallions till dry. Remove from heat; add tomato, cheese, egg and seasonings. Spoon
mixture on top of fillets and broil five inches from heat until cheese is melted and slightly browned. 
*(Rev.
3/7/97)*
ingredients: 2 lbs. Scrod (or Haddock or Flounder) fish fillets
1 medium-size ripe tomato, peeled, seeded and chopped
name: Cheese Topped Fish
